tit.e: Mingaku (Ming-era Chinese music, popularized in Japan during the early 17th century)

sen.j: 明楽(みんがく)とは、江戸時代に明朝から日本に伝えられた廟堂(びょうどう)音楽の名称である。
sen.e: Mingaku is the name of music to be played in mausoleum halls or the imperial court, and the music was brought to Japan in the Edo period from the Ming dynasty.
Mingaku is the name of the music to be played in mausoleum halls or the Imperial Court, and the music was brought to Japan from the Ming dynasty during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: article
sen.e: Mingaku is the name of the music played in mausoleum halls or the Imperial Court, and the music was brought to Japan from the Ming dynasty during the Edo period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 明楽の伝来は、明国の魏之琰（ぎしえん）（1617年?-1689年）の帰化にさかのぼる。
sen.e: The introduction of Mingaku to Japan goes back when Gishien of Ming (1617? - 1689) became a Japanese national.
The introduction of Mingaku to Japan dates back to when Gishien of Ming (1617? - 1689) became a Japanese national.

sen.e: The introduction of Mingaku to Japan dates back to when Gishien of Ming (c.1617 - 1689) became naturalized in Japan.

sen.j: 福建省福州府福清県の出であったが、明末清初の戦乱を避けて安南国、後にトンキンへと赴いた。
sen.e: Coming from Fuqing, Fuzhou, Fujian, he went to Annan and to Tonkin later.

sen.j: そこで長崎との白糸の交易の船主となって、富を築いた。
sen.e: There, he became the owner of a ship for trading silk at Nagasaki, building up a fortune.

sen.j: 正保四年（1637年）には長崎に崇福寺 (長崎市)の建立に多大な寄進をして四大檀越すなわち魏王何林の一つに名を連ねた。
sen.e: In 1637, he made a huge contribution for constructing Sofuku-ji Temple (located in Nagasaki City), being listed in the Yon-dai Danotsu (the Four Danapati [donators]) or one of Gio-nanrin.

sen.j: 彼は交易に携わる傍ら、明国の宗室や廟の音楽に造詣が深かったが、それらの音楽を長崎で一族郎党を率い演奏していた。
sen.e: While engaging in trade, he was well versed in music played in Imperial court or mausoleum halls in Ming, and played these pieces of music with his family and followers.

sen.j: 彼は願い出て上京し、延宝元年（1673年）には内裏で演奏するなど、明楽は広まりを見せた。
sen.e: He requested permission to visit Kyoto and came to Kyoto, and made Mingaku known widely, fro example, playing such music in dairi (Imperial Palace) in 1673,.

sen.j: 延宝七年（1679年）には長崎奉行に許されて日本に帰化し、福建の出身地から鉅鹿（おおが）姓を名乗った。
sen.e: In 1679, he became a Japanese national through permission by Nagasaki bugyo (Nagasaki magistrate), and used the name of Oga after his birth place in Fujian Province.

sen.j: 魏之琰から四代目にあたる魏皓(ぎこう)（1728年?-1774年）（魏君山、鉅鹿民部規貞）は、特に秀でた音楽の才能を持っていた。
sen.e: Giko, a fourth-generation descendent of Gishien (1728? - 1774) (Gikunzan or OGA Minbu Norisada) had a an especially good talent in music.

sen.j: 彼は家督を継ぐ事を好まなかった。
sen.e: He did not like to take over the position of head of his family.

sen.j: また自分の家の中だけで伝承されていた明楽を世に広めたいと考え、京にのぼり諸侯の前で明楽を奏した。
sen.e: Instead, considering that the Mingaku, having been inherited from generation to generation within his family descendents, should be made known more widely, he went to Kyoto and played Mingaku in front of feudal lords.

sen.j: また姫路藩主の酒井雅楽頭の扶持も受け、一時は百人もの弟子を抱えまでになり、広く明楽を貴族階級、武士階級に広めた。
sen.e: Furthermore, he got salary from Sakai Uta no kami (the Sakai clan, Director of Music), the lord of the Himeji domain, had as many as a hundred followers at a time, and made Mingaku widely known by people in the noble class and in the samurai class.

Furthermore, he obtained a salary from Sakai Uta no kami (the Sakai clan, Director of Music), the lord of the Himeji domain, had as many as 100 followers at a time, and made Mingaku widely known by people of the nobility and the samurai class.

sen.j: 明和5年(1768)、魏皓は明楽の曲を工尺譜(こうせきふ)で書き表し、門人のための教科書『魏氏楽譜』を刊行した。
sen.e: In 1768, he recorded scores of Mingaku in gongchepu (a music score-expressing method), and published "Wei shi yue pu" (Score by Wei Family) as a textbook for his followers.
In 1768, he recorded the scores of Mingaku in gongchepu (a method of musical notation), and published "Wei shi yue pu (Score by the Wei Family)" as a textbook for his followers.
sen.cmt: grammar

sen.j: 魏氏伝来の楽曲は全部で243曲の多きにのぼった。
sen.e: As many as 243 music compositions had been descended from generation to generation in the Gi clan.

sen.j: しかし、そのうち魏皓が生前に門人に伝授した曲は半分の百余曲で、『魏氏楽譜』に収録されたのはさらにその半分の50曲のみであった。
sen.e: However, only a hundred of them, about a half of them, were handed over to his followers while Giko was still alive, and only fifty compositions, further a half of them, were recorded in "Wei shi yue pu" (scores by the Wei family).

sen.j: 高弟の跋文によると続刊を刊行する計画があったようだが、魏皓が死去したため、残念ながら50曲のみで刊行終了となった。
sen.e: According to Batsubun, his leading disciple, it was likely that the publication of another textbook following the first one was planned, but because Giko died, the publication ended regrettably after only 50 compositions were recorded.

sen.j: 明和年間(1764年－1772年)に最盛期を迎えた明楽は、清楽(しんがく)の流行に押されて急速にすたれ、その一部は清楽に取り入れられた。
sen.e: After the period of 1764 - 1772 when Mingaku was most prosperous, Mingaku declined rapidly due to an increase in the popularity of Shingaku, with some natures of Mingaku taken into Shingaku.

sen.e: Many of the lyrics to these songs are from Chinese poetry and Tang and Sung poetry, and were sung in the Tang pronunciation in Japan.

sen.j: 声楽が主体だが、それにあわせて器楽で伴奏し、舞いも踊られた。
sen.e: Singing constituted the major part of the music, but music instruments were also played accompanying the song, with mai dances played as well.
Singing constituted the major part of the music, but musical instruments were also played to accompany the songs, as they also were with mai dances.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Singing constituted the major portion of the music, but musical instruments were also played to accompany the songs, and also dances were performed to the music.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 当時の日本では、雅楽などの例外をのぞけば、これだけ大規模な楽隊編成は他になかった。
sen.e: In Japan at that time, no other music, except Gagaku, was played by a group of so many persons.
In Japan at that time, no other music (except for Gagaku) would be played by such large groups of participants.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: At that time, music would not be played by such a large group of participants in Japan except for Gagaku and the like.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 仏教の声明(しょうみょう)音楽に器楽演奏を添えたような感じの、力強く荘重な音楽であった。
sen.e: It was powerful and stately music, something like Shomyo (chanting of Buddhist hymns) music with instruments played additionally.
It was powerful and stately music, something like Shomyo (the chanting of Buddhist hymns) music with instruments played additionally.
sen.cmt: grammar, punctuation
sen.e: It was powerful and stately music, something like Shomyo (the chanting of Buddhist hymns) music accompanied by instruments.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 明楽で使う楽器は「管四、弦三、打四」であった。
sen.e: In Mingaku, the following music instruments were used: four window instruments, three stringed instruments and four percussion instruments.
In Mingaku, the following music instruments were used: four window instruments, three stringed instruments and four percussion instruments.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In Mingaku, 'four wind instruments, three stringed instruments and four percussion instruments' were used.

sen.j: 管楽器：巣笙（そうしょう） 觱篥(ひつりつ) 龍笛(りゅうてき) 長簫(ちょうしょう)
sen.e: The window instruments: Sosho, Hitsuritsu, Ryuteki and Chosho

sen.e: The wind instruments were the Sosho, Hitsuritsu, Ryuteki and Chosho.

sen.e: The stringed instruments: Shoshitsu, Biwa and Gekkin

sen.e: The stringed instruments were the Shoshitsu, Biwa and Gekkin.

sen.j: 打楽器：太鼓 小鼓（しょうこ） 雲鑼（うんら） 壇板（だんばん）
sen.e: The percussion instruments: Taiko, shoko, Unra and Danban

sen.e: The percussion instruments were the Taiko, Shoko, Unra and Danban.

sen.e: The percussion instruments were the Taiko, Shoko, Unra and Danban.

sen.j: 巣笙と觱篥は、それぞれ日本の雅楽の笙と篳篥(ひちりき)にあたる(ただし、楽器のサイズや形状が微妙に違い、それにともない音色もやや異なる)。
sen.e: Sosho and Hitsuritsu correspond to Sho and Hichiriki in Japan, respectively (however, their sizes and shapes are different subtly, making sound characteristics different slightly as well).
Sosho and Hitsuritsu correspond to Sho and Hichiriki in Japan, respectively (however, their sizes and shapes are subtly different, making their sound characteristics slightly different as well).

sen.e: Sosho and Hitsuritsu correspond to Sho and Hichiriki in Japan, respectively (however, their sizes and shapes are subtly different, making their tones slightly different as well).

sen.j: 龍笛は薄い笛幕(てきまく)を穴に張ったいわゆる明笛(みんてき)で、長簫は日本の尺八を細く長くしたような形の洞簫である。
sen.e: Ryuko is so-called Minteki (a flute in Ming) in which thin Tekimaku (cloth for a fue flute) is placed over holes, and Chosho is a dongxiao (Chinese bamboo flute similar to a shakuhachi) that is thinner and longer than a Shakuhachi bamboo flute.

sen.j: 琵琶は現代中国のものにくらべると薄く華奢な作りである。
sen.e: The Biwa is made thinner and more delicately than that in the present-day China.
The Biwa was fashioned in a more slender, delicate form than that of present-day China.

sen.e: The Biwa was fashioned in a more slender, delicate form than the modern Chinese Biwa.

sen.j: 明楽の月琴は、長いさおをもつ阮咸(げんかん)のことである。
sen.e: Gekkin in Mingaku is Genkan (4 or 5-stringed Chinese lute) with a long neck.

sen.j: 清楽や現代中国の「月琴」と名前は同じでも、実際は違う楽器を指すので、注意を要する。
sen.e: Caution is needed because this Gekkin is an instrument different from the Gekkin in Shingaku and in the present-day China, although the same term is used.

sen.j: 明楽で使用する弦楽器は撥弦楽器のみである。
sen.e: The stringed instruments used in Mingaku were only plucked-type ones.
The stringed instruments used in Mingaku were only of the plucked type.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The stringed instruments used in Mingaku were only of the plucked type.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 清楽と違い、胡琴(いわゆる「二胡」など)のような擦弦楽器は使用しない。
sen.e: Contrary to the stringed instruments used in Shingaku, no rubbing-type ones like Kokin (so-called Niko) are not used.
Unlike the stringed instruments used in Shingaku, no rubbing-type ones like Kokin (so-called Niko) were used.

sen.j: 幕末から明治にかけて、明楽は絶滅寸前の状態であった。
sen.e: In the era from towards the end of the Edo period to the Meiji period, Mingaku was on the verge of extinction.
In the era from the late Edo period to the Meiji period, Mingaku was on the verge of extinction.

sen.j: 不幸中の幸い、明治年間に音楽取調掛(東京芸術大学の前身)が、鉅鹿氏の子孫から明楽の楽器や楽器図、楽譜図などの資料をまとめて購入した。
sen.e: However, it was lucky that Ongaku Torishirabe Gakari (Institute for Music Investigation) (the predecessor of Tokyo University of the Arts) purchased from a descendant of the Oga clan an entire set of materials and documents concerned with Mingaku, such as instruments, drawings of instruments and drawings of scores.

sen.j: おかげで、明楽の資料は比較的よく残っている(現在これらの資料は東京芸術大学が所蔵)。

sen.j: 上述の『魏氏楽譜』には、「江陵楽」「蝶恋花」「喜遷鶯」「陽関曲」「賀聖朝」「昭君怨」「如夢令」など五十曲の楽譜が収録されている。

sen.j: 今日の楽譜と違った。
sen.e: The style of music scores at that time was totally different as that of today.

sen.j: 楽譜の肝心な部分は、弟子が肉筆で加筆するようになっている(師匠に手続きをふんで入門し、門人にならないと、楽譜を教えてもらえない仕組みになっていた）。
sen.e: At that time, the core parts of a score had not been written in advance, and each follower of a master had to add those parts later by himself or by herself (the system was employed in which, when a person wanted to know some music scores, the person had to enter the school of the master, teaching the scores, through necessary procedures and to become his disciple).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At that time, the core parts of a score weren't written in advance, so each follower of a master had to add those parts later (the system was employed in which, when a person wanted to learn certain musical scores it was necessary to enter the school of the master, learn the scores through necessary procedures, and become his disciple).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: At that time, the core parts of a score weren't written in advance, so each disciple of a master had to add those parts later (the system was employed in which, when a person wanted to learn certain musical scores it was necessary to enter the school of the master through necessary procedures and become his disciple.)
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: こうしたことは、江戸時代の芸道では、よく見られた。
sen.e: Such a way of teaching was used in studying an art in the Edo period.
This manner of teaching was also used in the study of art during the Edo period.

sen.j: 日本では明楽の楽器の現物のセットと『魏氏楽譜』という完備した楽譜が残っているのに対して、中国本土では明楽についての資料はほとんど残っていない。
sen.e: While, in Japan, a set of real music instruments and the complete scores called "Wei shi yue pu" remain for Mingaku, almost nothing about Mingaku remains in the mainland of China.
While in Japan a set of real music instruments and the complete scores called "Wei shi yue pu" remain for Mingaku, almost nothing about Mingaku remains in mainland China.

sen.j: そのため『魏氏楽譜』(に書き込まれた楽譜)は、中国本土の音楽研究者にとっても第一級の資料となっている。
sen.e: Therefore, the scores written in "Wei shi yue pu" has become the first class documents even for researchers of music in the main land of China.

sen.e: Now, reproduced Mingaku has been played by Sakata Classic Music Institution at Yushima Seido (Sacred Hall at Yushima) in Tokyo.
